page.title: 14Trench Hall Farm
page.content: The farms which once served Ravensworth Estate have changed in character since their sale in l965. Generally the soils have been disturbed by (large scale) open cast mining. They form an open "green belt" on the S-West extremity of the Tyne-Wear conurbation. Farming is mixed, but highly specialised, the largest farm, Trench Hall, breeds French and Swiss cattle for live sale at home and abroad. It occupies 420 acres of arable land between 55-85m growing barley, wheat and potatoes (under contract to a local crisp factory), and ley grass. In l985 oil seed rape was cultivated encouraged by the high financial returns afforded under the EEC's CAP.s
